page.title: 17EDUCATION
page.content: Wood End is a Junior and Infants School built in 1965 on 6-7 acres. There are 200 pupils who are taught in classes of 25-36, with 7 classes in all. The school has 7 full-time and 1 part-time teacher. The pupils only leave their classroom for physical education and music lessons. The pupils wear a uniform and the school day begins at 8.50 am and finishes at 3.30 pm. There are frequently clubs held after school. Each year all the older pupils are taken to Wales for a few days and other local day trips are taken. The school is built mainly of wood, glass and brick and as it is not double glazed, is very expensive to heat. Two years ago the oil central heating was converted to gas to try to be more economical.
